The second possible outcome is that people would rely on alternative forms of currency such as cryptocurrencies, gift cards or loyalty points.
The third possible outcome is that people would use barter markets, where goods and services are exchanged without the use of currency.
The fourth possible outcome is that people would turn to government-issued labor credits or stock certificates as a means of exchange.
The fifth possible outcome is that people would return to a more cash-based society, similar to those in the early days of the industrial revolution.
The sixth possible outcome is that people would invest in physical assets such as land, buildings or stocks and use these as a means of exchange.
